intro: Tripogon tirumalae, commonly known as the Tirumala grass, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
